list.comment:
UI overhaul with local Bootstrap
- Added Bootstrap CSS to the project under /static and switched base.html to load it locally. - Pages now use a shared base template and Bootstrap components (navbar, table, badges, modal). - Achieved a consistent, responsive layout without external CDN dependency.

feat: Add unified incident management and improve UI/UX
This commit introduces a major refactor to the application's incident management system.
- **Unified Incident Details:** Implemented a single, unified routing system (`/incident/<string:unique_id>`) to handle both open and archived incidents, resolving the duplicate ID bug. The `unique_id` is now a composite of the incident's origin (main/archive) and its `doc_id`.
- **Improved User Experience (UI/UX):** - Revamped the application's styling with a modern, clean CSS framework for better readability and aesthetics. - Replaced the inline "Add Incident" form with a user-friendly modal popup to streamline the main page layout. - Corrected all `url_for` calls across `index.html`, `details.html`, and `archive_results.html` to align with the new routing logic, eliminating previous 404 errors.
- **Backend Enhancements:** - Added logic to the `incident_details` route to correctly handle incidents from both the main database and archive files. - Ensured the `update` route correctly archives incidents when their status is set to "Resolved" or "Closed".

Fix archive handling and unique_id generation
- Ensure archived incidents get a correct unique_id (`archive::<filename>::<uuid>`) at the moment of archival. - Prevent index() from overwriting archived recordsâ€™ unique_id. - Guarantees that links to closed incidents now resolve correctly without 404. - No changes needed to templates except confirming `incident.unique_id` is used in href.
